text:
Pop star Harry Styles lifted the spirits of a teenage victim of last week’s Manchester bombing by surprising her with a phone call as she recovers in the hospital.

The former One Direction singer reached out to Freya Lewis, 14, with a call on Saturday, her family revealed in a blog post.

“The phone rang, and it was Harry Styles,” reads the message shared on the Holmes Chapel Comprehensive School website. “Freya woke up, Harry said he loved her, she said she loved him, then Dad said he loved him!!”

“The PICU unit at Manchester Childrens Hospital has just been given a lift like you can not imagine!”

The young girl was one of the dozens injured outside the Manchester Arena last Monday when a suicide bombing detonated an explosive device following Ariana Grande’s concert in the venue. The horrific act of terror, which ISIS has claimed responsibility for, left 22 people dead, including Freya’s friend Nell Jones.

Freya was hit with shrapnel during the attack, leaving her with several fractures, burns and lacerations.

Freya’s sister, Georgia, shared a Facebook video last week in an effort to garner enough support to get Styles’ attention and potentially put him in touch with Freya.

The girl’s family has provided regular updates on her condition through blog posts since she checked into the hospital.

“Another good day today for Freya after a comfortable night,” read the most recent post, which was shared Monday. “Next round of surgery now tomorrow p.m. … Plenty of time awake today, read her a lot of cards and letters from people, some smiles, some tears.”

Styles was one of many celebrities to share their heartbreak in the aftermath of the bombing.

“I’m heartbroken over what happened in Manchester tonight,” he tweeted last Monday. “Sending love to everyone involved.”

Grande, meanwhile, vowed to return to the English city for a benefit concert in support of those affected by the act of terror.
title: Harry Styles calls 14-year-old victim of Manchester bombing, tells her he loves her
